issue.title: Fixing encoding issue 136
issue.body:
Fixing a interop issue with how the ECDH shared secret is represented before passed as input into the SSH KDF. It should no longer be an `mpint`, it is should be raw data / `byte` array. Btw, that is what OpenSSH does with its X25519+SNTRU PQ-hybrid key exchange method. 

More details in [issue #136](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh/issues/136)

Patch courtesy of @geedo0 .

Fixes #136

comment.body: Are we okay to merge without the AppVeyor builds passing?

issue.title: Update method names in kex.h
issue.body:
[PR# 136](https://github.com/csosto-pk/opensshpq-136/pull/1) breaks backwards compatibility for PQ-hybrid key exchange methods. As agreed in [Issue #136](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh/issues/136) we ought to update the names. 

This PR includes two commits
- [Commit #16c98d1](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh/pull/138/commits/16c98d1f34b7d38d2fa792e520e16a5913acf65e) updates just the three method names which are in [the draft](https://github.com/csosto-pk/pq-ssh/blob/master/draft-kampanakis-ssh-pq-ke.txt). If you want to reject the second commit in this PR, feel free to just take this one.
- [Commit #5fd6eab](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh/pull/138/commits/5fd6eabe5614e5ba5f26a572b73bbcb6c41b9dcb) updates the rest of the PQ-hybrid key exchange method names. 
  - It does not use `-d00` as these are not in the draft.
  - It uses `-r2` for Frodo since it was not picker in Round 3. For the rest it uses `-r3`.

comment.body: Are we okay to merge without the AppVeyor builds passing?

issue.body:
[PR# 136](https://github.com/csosto-pk/opensshpq-136/pull/1) breaks backwards compatibility for PQ-hybrid key exchange methods. As agreed in [Issue #136](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh/issues/136) we ought to update the names. 

This PR includes two commits

If you want to reject the second commit in this PR, feel free to just take this one.
- [Commit #5fd6eab](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh/pull/138/commits/5fd6eabe5614e5ba5f26a572b73bbcb6c41b9dcb) updates the rest of the PQ-hybrid key exchange method names. 
  - It does not use `-d00` as these are not in the draft.
  - It uses `-r2` for Frodo since it was not picker in Round 3. For the rest it uses `-r3`.

comment.body:
> Are we okay to merge without the AppVeyor builds passing?

Personally I don't consider this appropriate: Either we disable tests (as part of a PR) that we now consider irrelevant (e.g., because we don't want to support Windows any more) or we stick to the same (test) standard we applied before. In either case, CI should be "green".

issue.title: Fixing encoding issue 136
issue.body:
Fixing a interop issue with how the ECDH shared secret is represented before passed as input into the SSH KDF. It should no longer be an `mpint`, it is should be raw data / `byte` array. Btw, that is what OpenSSH does with its X25519+SNTRU PQ-hybrid key exchange method. 

More details in [issue #136](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh/issues/136)

Patch courtesy of @geedo0 .

Fixes #136

comment.body:
> Are we okay to merge without the AppVeyor builds passing?

No need to repeat myself.

> probably time for a revamp.

Yes. If we don't have time for this, my preference would be to remove (documented) Windows support (and AppVeyor along with it) -- possibly creating a new issue to re-enable it at some future time when someone considers this platform relevant again.

issue.title: replace oqs-openssl111
issue.body:
With https://github.com/openssl/openssl/pull/19312 merged, oqs-provider together with OpenSSL3 (master) now deliver the same level of functionality as oqs-openssl111. 
This issue is to propose replacing oqs-openssl111 with openssl3+oqs-provider where possible in the demos.

Applicable integrations (tick if done) -- suggested order of importance
- [x] openssl3
- [x] OpenVPN
- [x] curl
- [ ] nginx
- [ ] httpd
- [ ] epiphany
- [ ] envoy
- [ ] quic
- [ ] mosquitto
- [ ] ngtcp2
- [ ] unbound
- [ ] haproxy

Not applicable: Wireshark, Chromium, openssh, openlitespeed

comment.body:
`haproxy` testing (via curl) now fails as `haproxy` is still using `oqs-openssl111` and we severed the "interoperability tie" between `oqs-provider` (used by `curl`) and `oqs-openssl111` (used by `haproxy`).

Question thus: Would anyone mind we drop `haproxy` from the list of supported (and tested) integrations (until someone finds time and interest again to support it -- via new PR)?

issue.title: Review IDs
issue.body:
In preparation for the IETF hackathon (and the next release), this issue is to check all algorithm IDs are in line with recent `liboqs` code updates:
- Falcon (see #125)
- BIKE (see #116)

Anything else? @bhess @xvzcf @dstebila : Did we really only update these two algorithms (breaking KATs/requiring TLS ID changes)?

comment.body:
> Anything else? @bhess @xvzcf @dstebila : Did we really only update these two algorithms (breaking KATs/requiring TLS ID changes)?

Wasn't there a SPHINCS+ update changing the PRF from SHA256 to SHA512?

Can you point to a PR? When glancing over last year's PRs, there's nothing with the label "sphincs" standing out...

Anything else? @bhess @xvzcf @dstebila : Did we really only update these two algorithms (breaking KATs/requiring TLS ID changes) since the last Hackathon in November 2022? (period of interest since last interop test added)

comment.body: Ah ok, the PR with the change isn't merged yet: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1420

comment.body:
> > Are we okay to merge without the AppVeyor builds passing?
> 
> No need to repeat myself.
> 
> > probably time for a revamp.
> 
> Yes. If we don't have time for this, my preference would be to remove (documented) Windows support (and AppVeyor along with it) -- possibly creating a new issue to re-enable it at some future time when someone considers this platform relevant again.

Yes, you're right, we should do this cleanly.

I spent a few minutes looking at the AppVeyor test configuration but can't see anything obvious causing the permissions error nor how to obviously fix it.

I'm not going to be able to investigate further for several weeks, so unless someone else can, we either leave this open or we remove the AppVeyor tests and add an issue tracking that.

issue.title: Dev: Poc update docker build steps with buildx
issue.body:
this is poc of #19 
1. as some package depends or package version is changed, hence I just ref https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs#linuxmacos to refined apt install steps.
2. as for buildx it takes a lot of time, hence .... just poc for now.
3. as I don't have token/apikey to push image, hence in this PR just build image without push it.

comment.body: Thanks! I will review and merge those by next week

Applicable integrations (tick if done) -- suggested order of importance

comment.body: Given today's decision to keep supporting oqs-openssl111 work on this topic is put on the backburner. I personally would very much welcome other's contributions regarding maintenance of oqs-openssl111.
